record.dc:title: 3BT20, 15BT20, Butler County, Kentucky. Annis Village. Detail In Structure Area II.
record.wpa:project_reservoir: Late Prehistoric Mississippian Sites in Kentucky
record.wpa:narrative: Charred posts and cane occurring approximately on the floor level of Structure II, and lying just below the plow line. The pieces shown are about .1' to .2' in diameter. In the center foreground are several pieces of charred cane overlying a charred pole. At the left lower is a vertical section of roof support pole .5' in diameter, .3' in height, preserved as Field Specimen #6 (dendrochronological). Top center is a sizeable section of very crumbly but rather thick pottery. View from the west.
record.wpa:comments: See also photograph 2BT20 for relationship of this charred material to the remainder of the structure area.
